questiontext.text: Suppose you drill a hole and then measure it. We define the event A if the diameter of the hole is larger than 2.3 cm and smaller than 2.5 cm. What then is the complement event of A, if \(\bar{A}\)?

answer.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is less than 2.3 cm}

feedback.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is less than 2.3 cm}: Incorrect

answer.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is greater than 2.5 cm}

feedback.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is greater than 2.5 cm}: Incorrect

answer.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is greater than 4.8 cm}

feedback.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is greater than 4.8 cm}: Incorrect

answer.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is less than 2.3 cm or greater than 2.5 cm}

feedback.text: \(\bar{A}\) = {the diameter of the hole is less than 2.3 cm or greater than 2.5 cm}: Correct
